wikipedia_page.main: Benjamin Parsons (1797–1855) was an English congregational minister. He was known as a political campaigner who involved his congregation.

response: Lloyd was born in the parish of Ebley near Stroud in 1860 to Anna Lloyd and her husband. Her grandfather was Benjamin Parsons who had founded and led schools. She was educated at her mother's school, but a university education was denied her because of the cost (although her brother did attend Cambridge University).

Lloyd was born near Stroud in 1837. Her father was Benjamin Parsons who founded and led schools.Bertha Porter, ‘Parsons, Benjamin (1797–1855)’, rev. Anne Pimlott Baker, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 19 January 2017 She was educated at her father's school. She married Thomas Lloyd who took over her father's parish when he retired.Elaine Kaye, ‘Lloyd , Anna Shatford (1837–1912)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 19 January 2017
:— Benjamin Parsons, English congregational minister (10 January 1855)
